title: Should I get a Masters in Information Technology? Will it be useful? - Quora

response.answer_text: I will divide my answer in two section. You should go for master if You are from tier 2 college and want to add the tag of a good NIT or IIT .You are not satisfied with your job and want to explore more opportunity in computer science or information technology field.You want to pursue a career in research in computer science and you are passionate in some related field .You want to pursue doctorate in some field in which you are passionate.If you are interested in teaching as professor in college as you are passionate in both teaching and computer science or information technology.If you want to go and settle in abroad then do MS from US or in other country .You have gotten stuck in a service based company.You should not go for masters if If you want to make a good career in corporate world.If you already are good in programming and have great problem solving profile.If you want to become a good programmer only.If you are not interested in research and already are in a good company (product based company) at good position.If you are money oriented person.If already are from a good college (tier 1).You are not interested in teaching and passionate in programming.There are so many opportunity which you can grab just after your B.TECH . Just you have to have great software development and problem solving profile. As computer science is a very vast field filled with so many opportunity if you are passionate about the computer science . Just you need to develop the required skills . You have to have great skill in programming and good experience in programming. Update your skills by daily basis . Improve technology stack . Learn web development,Android Development, Machine Learning in Python ,Artificial Intelligence etc . This industry continuously evolving with great and different technology . If you want to survive in this industry then you are required to be updated with latest technology in demand in the industry .

If you have no work experience, having a master’s degree won’t get you very far. You definitely shouldn’t think of a master’s degree as a “ticket” to get a job in IT. It’s probably better to think of it as the “icing on the cake” to further polish your skills after you’ve gained some level of work experience. It definitely is not a requirement for getting into most jobs in IT. It might be more useful to get into a consulting role but then only in conjunction with some level of experience.
